intro: Metrosideros falcata, commonly known as the New Zealand flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils along the shoreline. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
